newsitem.title: INDIA: India call rates seen at four pct next fortnight.
newsitem.headline: India call rates seen at four pct next fortnight.

text.p: Indian call money rates are expected to rise next fortnight, averaging four percent compared to the current 1.0-2.0 percent, ICICI Securities and Finance Company (I-Sec) said in a report on Wednesday.
Call money rates have been at abnormally low levels over the past week, I-Sec's latest Debt Market Update said.
"After starting the fortnight near double digit levels, overnight rates have steadily declined and have been between one and two percent since July 10," the I-Sec report said.
It said a six year government auction and the 364-day treasury bill issue are expected to squeeze out 40 billion rupees, helping push call money to more realistic levels.
"Strong outflows early next fortnight on account of the six year auction and the 364-day treasury bill auction are likely to see the fortnight in a deficit of about 13.0 billion rupees."
However, this amount is unlikely to put downward pressure on gilt prices or significantly harden call rates.
"Call rates are expected to average about four percent next fortnight," it said.
"The large amount of of subscription to RBI's repo auctions will provide a buffer and RBI intervention to buy dollars could be higher than estimated, further augmenting rupee liquidity."
